html:
Networks and Communications

In studying this module, you will learn about the fundamental concepts e.g. OSI/TCP suit, TCP and UDP communications, IP addressing, Ethernet, wireless networks, switching, routing, network design, documentation, management and troubleshooting. Upon successful completion of the module, you should become a skilled user who is able to design a network efficiently, can configure network devices e.g. switches, routers etc., can manage and troubleshoot network issues

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Develop a deeper knowledge and understanding on fundamental networking concepts and protocol suites i.e. osi reference model, tcp/ip, ip addressing etc. and their roles in network communications. [Knowledge and Understanding, Learning]

+  Select and configure industry standard network appliances e.g. switches, routers etc. [Learning, Enquiry, Reflection]

+  Design and implement small scale networks utilising switches, routers and wireless technologies. [Application, Reflection]

+  Identify problems and troubleshoot network errors. [Enquiry, Analysis, Problem Solving]

Module Content:
